clinical_study.brief_title: Neurosensory Deficit of Inferior Alveolar Nerve Following Mandibular Orthognathic Surgery.
clinical_study.official_title: Neurosensory Deficit of Inferior Alveolar Nerve Following Mandibular Orthognathic Surgery. A Prospective Longitudinal Clinical Trial.

lead_sponsor.agency: Riyadh Colleges of Dentistry and Pharmacy

clinical_study.source: Riyadh Colleges of Dentistry and Pharmacy

brief_summary.textblock:
This clinical study investigates the sensation deficit in the lower lip and chin area after surgical correction of lower jaw deformity.
The primary null hypothesis is: Lower jaw osteotomy cause no sensory deficit in the inferior alveolar nerve.
The secondary null hypothesis is: Concurrent genioplasty with sagittal split does not increase the risk of sensory deficit in the inferior alveolar nerve.

primary_outcome.description: Light touch sensation will be measured using cotton wisp applied to the chin and lower lip area divided into four quadrants: upper right, upper left, lower right, and lower left. The cotton wisp will be in touch with skin in the four quadrants and will be moved in four directions for each quadrant. The score will be recorded as 0 = No response to stimuli, 1= serious perception loss, 2 = hardly perceive sensation, 3 = perceive touch sensation at a lower degree than preoperative, and 4 = normal sensation.

Light touch sensation will be measured using cotton wisp applied to the chin and lower lip area divided into four quadrants: upper right, upper left, lower right, and lower left. The cotton wisp will be in touch with skin in the four quadrants and will be moved in four directions for each quadrant. The score will be recorded as 0 = No response to stimuli, 1= serious perception loss, 2 = hardly perceive sensation, 3 = perceive touch sensation at a lower degree than preoperative, and 4 = normal sensation.

Light touch sensation will be measured using cotton wisp applied to the chin and lower lip area divided into four quadrants: upper right, upper left, lower right, and lower left. The cotton wisp will be in touch with skin in the four quadrants and will be moved in four directions for each quadrant. The score will be recorded as 0 = No response to stimuli, 1= serious perception loss, 2 = hardly perceive sensation, 3 = perceive touch sensation at a lower degree than preoperative, and 4 = normal sensation.

A tip of sharp dental explorer will be used to measure the pinprick sensation applied to the chin and lower lip area divided into four quadrants: upper right, upper left, lower right, and lower left. The measurement will be recorded as a positive or negative response

A tip of sharp dental explorer will be used to measure the pinprick sensation applied to the chin and lower lip area divided into four quadrants: upper right, upper left, lower right, and lower left. The measurement will be recorded as a positive or negative response

A tip of sharp dental explorer will be used to measure the pinprick sensation applied to the chin and lower lip area divided into four quadrants: upper right, upper left, lower right, and lower left. The measurement will be recorded as a positive or negative response

primary_outcome.measure: Static two points discrimination first week
primary_outcome.description: A Vernier caliper will be used to measure static two-point discrimination applied to the chin and lower lip area divided into four quadrants: upper right, upper left, lower right, and lower left. Instrument spikes of the caliper will be set open on different separation distances. The score will be recorded as 0 = more than 15 mm, 1 = 10-15 mm, 2 = 9-10 mm, 3 = 7-9 mm, 4 = 6-7 mm, 5 = equal or less than 5 mm.

primary_outcome.measure: Static two points discrimination first month
primary_outcome.description: A Vernier caliper will be used to measure static two-point discrimination applied to the chin and lower lip area divided into four quadrants: upper right, upper left, lower right, and lower left. Instrument spikes of the caliper will be set open on different separation distances. The score will be recorded as 0 = more than 15 mm, 1 = 10-15 mm, 2 = 9-10 mm, 3 = 7-9 mm, 4 = 6-7 mm, 5 = equal or less than 5 mm.

primary_outcome.measure: Static two points discrimination three months
primary_outcome.description: A Vernier caliper will be used to measure static two-point discrimination applied to the chin and lower lip area divided into four quadrants: upper right, upper left, lower right, and lower left. Instrument spikes of the caliper will be set open on different separation distances. The score will be recorded as 0 = more than 15 mm, 1 = 10-15 mm, 2 = 9-10 mm, 3 = 7-9 mm, 4 = 6-7 mm, 5 = equal or less than 5 mm.

The measure will be preformed using test tube filled with hot water at temperature 45-50 degrees Celsius, and an ice cube applied to the chin and lower lip area divided into four quadrants: upper right, upper left, lower right, and lower left. The measurement will be recorded as a positive or negative response.

The measure will be preformed using test tube filled with hot water at temperature 45-50 degrees Celsius, and an ice cube applied to the chin and lower lip area divided into four quadrants: upper right, upper left, lower right, and lower left. The measurement will be recorded as a positive or negative response.

The measure will be preformed using test tube filled with hot water at temperature 45-50 degrees Celsius, and an ice cube applied to the chin and lower lip area divided into four quadrants: upper right, upper left, lower right, and lower left. The measurement will be recorded as a positive or negative response.

intervention.description: Surgical correction of lower jaw deformity by performing bilateral intraoral sagittal osteotomy of the mandible under general anesthesia.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with lower jaw deformity requiring bilateral sagittal split osteotomy
Exclusion Criteria:
- Medically compromised patients
- Previous neurosurgical procedure
- Patients on chronic medications
- Patients with a mental or psychiatric disorder
- Pregnant and lactating female
- Previous neurosensory deficit due to trauma, pathology, or surgery
- Patients with facial pain disorders including trigeminal neuralgia, temporomandibular disorder, or atypical facial pain

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Riyadh Colleges of Dentistry and Pharmacy
